channel.title: Looking for imp from Christmas 2005
channel.description:
Hello, my friend is working on remaking the old event back in 2005, and he's having trouble finding the ID of this npc: [img]http://images2.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20080227040511/runescape/images/a/a4/Imp_shake.gif[/img]
Anyone happen to know it? Tried several npc ID lists but none have those. Is it possible that jagex has immediately removed those npcs along with the update or..?

item.title: Looking for imp from Christmas 2005
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

Thanks a lot for the help guys, gonna let him know and test.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for imp from Christmas 2005
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

I Renamed it but I couldn’t figure out 2 of them, here,

	if(i == NPC_ID) { // NPC ID
		// aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; // What's this?
		// class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // What's This?
		entityDef.actions = new String[5];
		entityDef.actions[1] = "Attack"; // This string could be changed to anything, for example, in hunting, catch.
		entityDef.models = new int[1]; // Number of models the NPC uses, the [1] part
		entityDef.models[0] = #####; // MODEL ID
		entityDef.name = "@@@@"; // NPC name
		entityDef.combatLevel = ####; // Combat level
	}

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for imp from Christmas 2005
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

^ that’s for item definitions only, really. though i can refractor the definitions if you need.

hm, here, let me get one out of ma old client.
dont do rsps much anymore… or anything, so my explanation will be bare.

if(i == 3561) { entityDef.itemActions = new String[5];/has to do with options entityDef.itemActions[1] = "Attack";/option entityDef.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; /options again entityDef.anIntArray94[0] = 48675;/model entityDef.anInt77 = 12790;/model entityDef.anInt86 = 15;//size again entityDef.anInt67 = 12790;/model entityDef.anInt91 = 15;//size.. forgot if its width or height.. entityDef.aByte68 = 5;/tiles away from the npc (lets say if you attack something, it will attack it from 5 tiles away from the center tile of the npc) entityDef.name = "WildyWyrm";/obvious entityDef.combatLevel = 382;/obvious entityDef.description = "It's made of pure fire.".getBytes();/examine }
if i didnt get all of them right (probably not) then sorry, i remember little to none of this stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for imp from Christmas 2005
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:10, topic:405177”][quote author=Get Blitz link=topic=502173.msg3673895#msg3673895 date=1311120722]
Your client should have that already.
[/quote]
It already has the model, but not the NPC.

if(i == ###) { // NPC ID aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Don't need to worry class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; // This string could be changed to anything, for example, in hunting, catch. class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; // Number of models the NPC uses, the [1] part class5.anIntArray94[0] = #####; // MODEL ID class5.aString65 = "@@@@@"; // NPC name class5.anInt61 = ######; // Combat level }
I’m sure you can fill this out. Credits to SilentCJ, also this is for non-renamed. I have no idea what those arrays would be and such in Galkon’s Renamed client. You would put this in class5.java and you could either replace imps with that, or try extending the npc index and make it a new npc. What RuneScape did, was replace imps with that, and when the event was over, they replaced it back with the old imp.

Edit: The regular imp model is 2887.[/quote]
was galkons renamed the one that uses entitydef?

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for imp from Christmas 2005
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Get Blitz:

Your client should have that already.

It already has the model, but not the NPC.

if(i == ###) { // NPC ID aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Don't need to worry class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5]; class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; // This string could be changed to anything, for example, in hunting, catch. class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; // Number of models the NPC uses, the [1] part class5.anIntArray94[0] = #####; // MODEL ID class5.aString65 = "@@@@@"; // NPC name class5.anInt61 = ######; // Combat level }
I’m sure you can fill this out. Credits to SilentCJ, also this is for non-renamed. I have no idea what those arrays would be and such in Galkon’s Renamed client. You would put this in class5.java and you could either replace imps with that, or try extending the npc index and make it a new npc. What RuneScape did, was replace imps with that, and when the event was over, they replaced it back with the old imp.

Edit: The regular imp model is 2887.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for imp from Christmas 2005
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:4, topic:405177”]Could it possibly be a GFX when your player is picking up the imp?[/quote]Not so sure, at 2005 i had no idea what i was doing ongame i do kinda remember such event and i’m pretty sure the imps were walking around in christmas clothes.

Also yeah, i believe for the pickup up and shaking we’ll also need gfx.

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:5, topic:405177”]I don’t remember this… Was this where you got the yo-yo? Because that is right around when I joined, and I talked to Santa for it… The NPC list is chronological, in the sense that npc 1 is the first npc they made and ~ npc 3000 was the last. As long as your talking about 317. I know for a fact that it would still be in the cache, but they may of just overwrote a NPC with those models for that event. For example, there is a katana model in the cache that is ready to be equipped, yet you can’t spawn a katana. Your best bet would be to get a 317 model dump and look through the models for a npc like that. Then take those models and either create a new npc in your npc class, or overwrite imps with the new models.[/quote]It’s with the marionettes and stuff i think. Also that means i have to find an accurate cache and dump the model?

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for imp from Christmas 2005
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

I don’t remember this… Was this where you got the yo-yo? Because that is right around when I joined, and I talked to Santa for it… The NPC list is chronological, in the sense that npc 1 is the first npc they made and ~ npc 3000 was the last. As long as your talking about 317. I know for a fact that it would still be in the cache, but they may of just overwrote a NPC with those models for that event. For example, there is a katana model in the cache that is ready to be equipped, yet you can’t spawn a katana. Your best bet would be to get a 317 model dump and look through the models for a npc like that. Then take those models and either create a new npc in your npc class, or overwrite imps with the new models.

Read full topic

[/quote]
nah, i dont think jagex removes things like that out of their cache (They usually re use them).[/quote]I hope so, but i find it weird how it’s never included in any NPC IDs dump list.
